Nikon P7700 is one of the best point and shoot camera currently available. Some say Sony RX100 is the best it gives near DSLR quality. But I say at a price Tag of Rs 34500/- its just an expensive toy which definitely gives awesome quality but stands no where near a Full Frame sensor or even an APS-C sensor.The performance of Nikon P7700 is noisy at higher ISO levels (400+) but I don't think any professional photographer needs to go to those levels when this has a hot shoe and also supports remote flash.The lens of this camera is where it wins the race, f2 at wide angle which might seem small compared to the competitors but f4 at telephoto (200mm) is pretty awesome for this camera.Manual controls are way better than going into menu and changing settings for semi pro people this is a very good camera to learn the techniques of photography before one can invest in DSLR's.The expansion capabilities of this camera is another feature which sets it apart from others, it has filter threads (40.5mm) so if you are done with experimenting with shutter, aperture etc.. you can go get a bunch of filters and continue with the fun. Built in ND filter is added bonus along with a mic jack which might not seem like a necessity to most of the users till they actually use it and see the difference.None of the latest advanced compacts can match this camera in all round performance. In some specific features they are definitely better like Panasonic Lumix LX7 has a f1.4, Sony RX100 with its 1 inch sensor, Canon g15 with a view finder. But a good photographer knows that its the balance of all these features that provides good photos and not a single feature alone.All in all this is a fantastic camera who's premium price is totally justified by the features included in it.

Nikon Coolpix P7700 brings a more "DSLR-like" experience to pocket-sized camerashe Nikon Coolpix P7700 is the new "professional model in Nikon’s extensive range of Coolpix compact digital cameras. The Coolpix P7700 is the successor to the one-year-old P7100, the main additions being a back-illuminated 12-megapixel, 1/1.7-inch CMOS sensor, faster lens, vari-angle LCD screen and full 1080 video recording. The Nikon P7700 features a mechanically-stabilized 7.1x optical zoom with a focal range of 28-200mm and maximum apertures of f/2.0-4.0, built-in neutral density filter, sensitivity range of ISO 80 to 6400, RAW file support, 8fps burst shooting, external flash hotshoe, PASM shooting modes, 1080p HD video recording with stereo sound and a microphone jack, GPS support and a 3-inch, 920,000-dot LCD screen. Designed to appeal to the keen enthusiast photographer,
